subject: Business
title: Ethical Sourcing and Transparency
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ethical Sourcing and Transparency.

hook.text: Your chocolate bar may contain cocoa harvested by child labor in CÃ´te d'Ivoire.

buildup.text: Ethical sourcing means ensuring suppliers meet standards for labor, environment, and human rights.

discovery.text: Global supply chains often have 5-10 tiers of sub-suppliers. Visibility drops to near zero past the second tier.

twist.text: Consumers increasingly demand transparency. A viral social media post about poor labor practices can destroy a brand.

climax.text: Patagonia publishes its entire supply chain map. Full transparency became a competitive advantage.

punchline.text: If you can't see your supply chain, you can't trust it.

quiz.question: Why is supply chain transparency difficult to achieve?
options: Chains often have 5-10 tiers of sub-suppliers with near-zero visibility past the second
Transparency is illegal in most countries
Suppliers always share full information voluntarily
